scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L is a star with 1 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 10436.99 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L system


OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L b

OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2019-09, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 5.00 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L b is 1526.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L b is 12.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2018-BLG-0740L - System With 1 Exoplanet
